description.narrative: The overall goal is Vietnam’s energy transition is more equitable, inclusive and sustainable due to the human economy approach being integrated into the implementation of Power Development Plan 8 (PDP8). More specifically, essential elements of the humaneconomy approach will be blended into the Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA), which is the document guiding the implementation of PDP98. SEA is a mandatory part to help assess the environmental and social impacts of electricity development options,thereby drawing outthe most optimal plan and minimising adverse impacts on the environment and local populations. With human economy incorporated intoPDP8 implementation via SEA, various government bodies at multiple levels will strive to balance energy development with the associated social dimensions, ensure participation of relevant stakeholders, respect the voice and right of disadvantaged groups, women and farmers and incorporate good practices for a just and equitable energy transition. Therefore,a policy research and influencing project on “Human Economy and renewable energy transition in Vietnam: Promoting the inclusive renewable energy transitions in Vietnam by adopting a human economy approach” led by the Center for Analysis and Forecasting –under the Vietnam Academy of Social sciences and Oxfam Vietnam aims at below objectives in the following year in 2021-2022 • First, to develop a detailed human economy framework reflecting the inclusiveness in the renewable energy transitions in Vietnam. • Second, to assess the impact of the renewable energy transitions from policies and practice perspective on different groups, with a focus on vulnerable groups in Vietnam, and to propose policy recommendation on embracing social groups of the populationand businesses with better participation in such process.

participating-org.narrative: The Centre for Analysis and Forecas (CAF)

The Centre for Analysis and Forecasting (abbreviated as CAF), is a scientific research organization under the Vietnam Academy of Social Sciences, to perform research functions as analyzing impacts, forecasting development trends of Vietnam's socio-economic; to provide scientific foundations for the planning of the Party and State's socio-economic development strategies and policies; to carry out training and scientific consultancy on socio-economic issues at the request of domestic and foreign organizations.
Main functions including: • To research the theoretical and practical issues of Vietnam from an economic perspective; to clarify theoretical andpractical issues of the socio-economic development process in Vietnam • To give comments and criticism on important socio-economic development programs and projects at the request of ministries, branches and localities as assigned by VASS. • To provide scientificconsulting and public services regarding development issues, suitable to the functions andduties of the Center for Analysis and Forecasting. • To exchange scientific information with domestic and foreign organizations and agencies according to regulations; to manage documents, information, and library of the Center for Analysis and Forecasting; to publish scientific publications; to disseminate scientific research results and scientific knowledge.

description.narrative: Laws, policies and practices increasingly take into account identities of different groups of people on the move, especially those who face structural inequality and marginalization, including women and youth, and contribute to increased equality
cases harmful practices that are put to an end.
